TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The person's details and contact information.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: The mandatory information in this section is person’s name, date of birth and address. There can be multiple addresses associated with a person including temporary and correspondence addresses. These are stored on the PDS.

TaggedValue.value: Details of the person's name

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The person's stated gender.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other activities. Section 22 of the Gender Reassignment Act 2004 makes it an offence to disclose the history of a transgender patient who has had formal gender reassignment under the Act, unless consent has been sought. The exemption of disclosure is for medical professionals involved in direct medical care, but not currently for administrative and non-medical staff. For the full Act, see https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2004/7/contents. This risk can be mitigated by appropriate implementation; refer to the 111 Referral clinical safety case report and hazard log. One option is to leave out the “Sex” field but the implications and potential risks of that will need to be considered. The alternative is to ensure the design, including its Information Governance model, reduces this risk to an acceptable level as described in the clinical safety case and hazard log. A further mitigation on implementatio...

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: NHS data dictionary :- Person stated gender code

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The ethnicity of the person as specified by the person.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: This is not a mandatory field but is a required field due to it's importance in the care of an individual and understanding la persons individual level of risk based on ethnicity related illness.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: NHS data dictionary :- Ethnic category

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The religious affiliation as specified by the person.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED_CT:- Religion

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The person’s phenotypic sex. Determines how the person will be treated clinically.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: The persons phenotypic sex. Determines how the person will be treated clinically The definitions used for sex and gender use the NHS data dictionary definitions to ensure interoperability with other systems. However, we recognise that the definitions used do not reflect today’s more inclusive society. We have provided feedback on this to NHS data dictionary team in NHS Digital who are actively addressing this area, and any updates to the NHS data dictionary will update our standards. Sex and gender data items may cause accidental disclosure of gender reassignment without consent. This is because both fields are included in the demographic model. Having both may show a difference and therefore disclose gender reassignment without consent. It is unlawful to disclose, without consent, a person’s gender reassignment with or without a gender reassignment certificate recognise that the definitions used do not reflect today’s more inclusive society. We have provided feedback on this to NHS...

TaggedValue.name: valueSets

TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Indication that the person has opted out of registering with a GP.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - 1092961000000104 |Does not wish to register with an NHS general practitioner (finding)| OR 1092941000000100 |Family using private general practitioner (finding)|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The individual requirements of the person.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other health and care activities. This section allows for the sharing of any individual requirements the person may have, such as to support cognitive impairment or mobility issues. This may relate to special needs and would extend to include a record of reasonable adjustments. Specific disabilities would be included in the ’Problem list’ section however the requirements to support the disabilities (e.g. needs wheelchair access, needs large print etc.) would be included in this section. The accessible information requirements information would be the most recent requirement rather than a history of requirements.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A record of reasonable adjustments that must be provided by the service to comply with the Equality Act 2010.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other health and care. This includes an individuals requirement for soft lighting, no noise a quite room etc.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This is a reasonable adjustment record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Under the Equality Act 2010 , organisations have a legal duty to make changes in their approach or provision to ensure that services are as accessible to people with disabilities as they are for everybody else. These changes are called reasonable adjustments. Reasonable adjustments can mean alterations to buildings by providing lifts, wide doors, ramps and tactile signage, but may also mean changes to policies, procedures and staff training to ensure that services work equally well for people with physical or sensory disabilities, learning disabilities or long-term conditions such as dementia. Other adjustments include longer appointments, providing easy read materials or communications via a carer. This legal duty is anticipatory which means a service should know about a person’s need for adjustments when they are referred or present for care. For this to happen, and for optimum care to be delivered, adjustments need to be recorded and shared across the NHS.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT: - 1108111000000107 |Requires reasonable adjustments for health and care access (Equality Act 2010) (finding)|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The reasonable adjustment required e.g. requires specific contact method, requires communication professional

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for reasonable adjustment

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - Accessible information standard ^999002121000000109 |Accessible information - communication support simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)| ^999002151000000104 |Accessible information - requires communication professional simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)| ^999002131000000106 |Accessible information - requires specific contact method simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)| ^999002141000000102 |Accessible information - requires specific information format simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)| Refsets for other categories in development

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: description

TaggedValue.name: valueSets

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The safeguarding details of the person.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: This section includes any concerns in relation to safeguarding and is applicable to children and adults. This section includes whether a child is looked after and indicates the presence of a Child Protection Plan or Unborn Child Protection Plan. There may be situations where it is not advisable to share information in this section with the person to whom it relates, so local implementations may need to apply filters in these cases. Appropriate policies and technical solutions need to be in place for these situations. Access must be controlled to this information as per SCCI1609: Child Protection - Information Sharing.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Details of safeguarding concerns.

TaggedValue.name: description

If the service is known, and a code is available, it should be included otherwise the service should be described in free text.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A human-readable reference given to the person to use when contacting or going to the service referred on to. It is generated by the receiving service and supplied to the referrer as part of the Booking and Referral Standard (BaRS) messaging.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: The aim of this element is for it to be given to the patient by the referrer (Sender) service so they can take it to the service they are referred to (Receiver service), providing a link for the patient between the two services. Additionally, it’s a useful point of reference for the two services should they need to speak to each other about the patient’s care. BaRS have implemented a mechanism (in FHIR messaging) whereby when the Sender makes a referral request, they receive the human readable reference in the synchronous response. The Sender makes the request, the Receiver accept it and processes into their system and sends back a response to the Sender with the human readable reference to say it was successful.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This is a machine-readable reference which the Sender of any initial referral (i.e. it was not sent to them as a referral) generates and includes in their referral request. If the sender is not the initial referrer (i.e. they received a referral) they must include the original reference in their referral.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: This reference is to help support tracking of patients/people on multiple referrals through the system.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: This should be a globally unique identifier (GUID) value. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/guiddef/ns-guiddef-guid

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: An indication of the type of referral (e.g. 'Hospital Discharge Notification to Social Care', 'GP Referral', etc.)

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The method in which a referral is sent and received. This may be a letter, email, transcript of a telephone conversation, Choose and Book, in person (self-referral) etc.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Allow National Codes only Fax Phone Secure Messaging Secure Email Letter NHS E-Referral Service Self referral

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The reason for the referral, e.g. diagnosis, treatment, transfer of care due to relocation, investigation, second opinion, management of the patient (e.g. palliative care), or carer's concerns.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: The presenting complaints and issues and chief complaint record’s the person reported and referrer perceived needs of the person. ‘Reason for referral’ is used if needed to qualify those presenting complaints or issues or the reason for the choice of referral destination.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for reason for referral

TaggedValue.value: Records whether specific criteria required for referral, to a particular service, have been met (may be nationally or locally determined). This field is used to outline which criteria have been met where a service has indicated specific criteria and to explain the rationale for referral where criteria have not been met.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Presenting complaints or issues

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: This section is used in multiple Information Standards and in general terms describes the complaint or issues as perceived by the individual reporting the complaint or issue, including the referrer. A person can have multiple complaints or issues recorded in an Information Standard. This will be the Symptom Group (SG) or the Symptom Discriminator (SD) code description. This will replace the Chief Complaint code set

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The health problem or issue experienced by the person resulting in their attendance. This may include disease state, medical condition, response and reactions to therapies. e.g., blackout, dizziness, chest pain, follow up from admission, falls, a specific procedure, investigation or treatment.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for presenting complaint or issue

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The nature of the person's chief complaint as assessed by the care professional first assessing the person. Only ONE (chief complaint) sent as per the Chief Complaint code set (SNOMED CT).

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: Should a person describe multiple complaints, this allows for the clinician to capture the complaint the clinician regards as the main complaint. This will be the textual detail from the Symptom Group (SG) and Symptom Discriminator (SD) code description. This will replace Chief Complaint Code set

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value of the chief complaint

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT: - 991401000000107 | Emergency care presenting complaints or issues simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Any free text if no coded value is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Person stated description of the health problems and issues. This may differ from the clinicians impression. This may also be expressed on behalf of the person, eg by parent or carer.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: Person stated description of the health problems and issues. This may differ from the clinicians impression. This may also be expressed on behalf of the person, eg by parent or carer

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Repeat caller, if the person has called more than twice in 96 hours.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Yes or no

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The source of additional relevant information about the person e.g. summary care record or link via NRL or copy and paste local record e.g. Special Patient Notes (SPN)

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: As well as specifying the source of information or a link to the source, this can also be used to include local information which might not be available to the referring destination, e.g. Special Patient Notes.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text or url

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A summary of the problems that require investigation or treatment.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: This section allows for all the Chief Clinical Concern; problems and issues to be recorded. The Referral / PEM should inform the receiver of the main problem(s) / issues that were important during the 111 encounter

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This is a problem list record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under problem list. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A condition which needs addressing and so is important for every professional to know about when seeing the person. Problems may include diagnoses, symptoms, and social or behavioural issues

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: The CAS clinician may identify and wish to share a Chief Clinical Concern following a 111 encounter. This section allows for all relevant problems, and issues. This would include disabilities, including learning disabilities, and conditions such as autism where they fall into the above categories i.e., are diagnosed, seen as a problem by the person or are considered a condition or similar. Behavioural factors which are not formal diagnoses but could be seen as a problem for the person would also appear under this section. When a diagnosis has not yet been made, the most granular clinical concept with the highest level of certainty should be displayed. This may be a problem, symptom, sign, or test result, and may evolve over time, as a conventional diagnosis is reached. For example, when a patients ‘presenting complaints or issues’ are indigestion and belching, ‘dyspepsia’ may be deemed the ‘Chief Complaint’, the 111 clinicians ‘Chief Clinical Concern’ maybe a ‘gastric ulcer’. Which ...

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for the problem list.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT allows the coding of Problems which may also be ‘diagnoses’ or ‘issues’, depending on the context in which they are recorded, some codes may need to be 'qualified' by a number of attributes e.g. grade; severity; distribution; behaviour; laterality etc. e.g. Problem: Migraine Qualifier: SuspectedDue to limitations in how the receiving organisations ingest and present Qualifiers i.e. Not all systems can ingest the 'qualifier' into the receiving system. Qualifiers should not be used when coding an unconfirmed / suspected diagnosis. As this may result in a diagnosis being incorrectly coded in to the individuals EHR.To prevent incorrect coding of a diagnosis in the patients electronic health record it is recommended that any suspected diagnosis should be captured in free text only, until the issue is resolved.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if coding is not available or when the chief clinical concern; problem or issue requires a qualifier i.e. gastric ulcer - 'suspected'

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A date or estimated date that the problem began

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: This is the date of onset of the chief clinical concern; problem or issues

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Clinical Summary

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: A brief summary of the 111 encounter. This may include interpretation of the persons complaints and issues, using the chief complaint and the chief clinical concern. The summary may also list specific action(s). Planned actions will be recorded under ‘plan’.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description detailing a patient’s reason for attendance, results from the diagnostic and treatment process.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: This is a text field to allow the clinician to explain the persons situation and outcome of the encounter. The clinician may add additional information that they feel is relevant to share with the receiving service / GP

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Details of any risks related to the person.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This is a risks record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The start date of the risk.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The date the risk ended.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The risk to the person or others, this includes any risk the person might cause to themselves or to others. e.g. suicide, self harm.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for risk.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT: - <281694009 |Finding of at risk (finding)|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Additional details about the risk.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Allergies and adverse reactions

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: This is for person reported allergies or adverse reactions which may not be on the persons electronic health record. It is NOT to transfer the person's recorded allergies which the receiver can look up (e.g. via SCR, GP Record or shared care record). The full section has been kept for consistency even if only some of the elements are needed for this use case.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This is a allergies and adverse reactions record entry. There may be 1 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The type of reaction experienced by the person (allergic, adverse, intolerance)

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: FHIR value set :- Allergy, Intolerance

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The agent such as food, drug or substances that has caused or may cause an allergy, intolerance or adverse reaction in this person Or “No known drug allergies or adverse reactions” Or “Information not available”

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for causative agent

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: dm+d:- any code from the VTM, VMP, AMP, VMPP, AMPP and ingredient concept classes SNOMED CT : - <105590001 |Substance OR <373873005 |Pharmaceutical / biologic product| OR <<716186003 |No known allergy| OR 196461000000101 |Transfer-degraded drug allergy| OR 196471000000108 |Transfer-degraded non-drug allergy)

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Details of the reaction.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The substance, or a class of substances, that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for substance

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - <105590001 | Substance (substance) | or <373873005 | Pharmaceutical / biologic product (product) |

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description of the manifestation of the allergic or adverse reaction experienced by the person. For example, skin rash.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for description of reaction.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT: - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Date and time when manifestations showed e.g could be at home a few days earlier than the contact

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description of the severity of the reaction.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for severity

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: FHIR value set : - Severity

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description of the certainty that the stated causative agent caused the allergic or adverse reaction.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The route the person was exposed to the substance

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for route of exposure

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT: - ^999000051000001100 |ePrescribing route of administration simple reference set|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no coded text available

TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Any additional comment or clarification about the adverse reaction.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Results of investigations that confirmed the certainty of the diagnosis. Examples might include results of skin prick allergy tests

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: When the reaction was first experienced i.e this may not be the first time this has happened. May be a date or partial date (e.g. year) or text ( e.g. during childhood )

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The date the allergy was diagnosed as ended

TaggedValue.name: valueSets

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Any further comments on the person's allergies or adverse reactions.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Medications and medical devices

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: This is a generic section for recording all types of medication including those prescribed by healthcare professionals and administered by a person (or their carer). The medications section allows for using structured dose and timing information that is machine readable to facilitate the reading and transfer of medications information between systems and providers of care, through the structured dose direction cluster. Technical guidance for implementing the structured dose and timing in Fast Healthcare Interoperable Resource (FHIR) messaging is available from NHS Digital https://developer.nhs.uk/apis/dose-syntax-implementation/. The free text Dose directions description is the form of dosage direction typically used in UK GP Systems. Dose direction duration can be derived from the start and end dates if no other information is available. When sharing Dose duration direction, the following examples are provided to clarify definitions for two of the coded text items which appear simi...

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: All medications and devices that can be prescribed to be entered via this Medication item entry. Handles details of continuation / addition / amendment of admission medications.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Medication item cluster

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: May be generic name or brand name.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for medication name

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: dm+d:- any code from the VTM, VMP, AMP, VMPP and AMPP concept classes

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The form of the medication e.g. capsule, drops, tablet, lotion etc.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for form.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT: - ^999000781000001107 | National Health Service dictionary of medicines and devices dose form simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The route by which the medication is administered e.g. oral, IM, IV

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for route

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT: - ^999000051000001100 |ePrescribing route of administration simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The anatomical site at which the medication is to be administered.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for site

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT: - <442083009 | Anatomical or acquired body structure (body structure) |

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used when code is not available

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The technique or method by which the medication is to be administered.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for method

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - ^999000041000001103 | ePrescribing method simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no coded text available

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Indicates if the medication or device is acquired without a prescription i.e. got by the person over the counter

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Flag : - Yes or No

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A structural representation of the elements carried by the dose syntax in 'parsable dose strength / timing' i.e. dose strength, dose timing, dose duration and maximum dose.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A structural representation of dose amount, e.g. 20mg or 2 tablets. This element will generally only be used when persisting data within systems with 'parsable dose directions' being used to exchange the same information between systems. As per FHIR Dose Syntax Implementation Guidance (NHS Digital): https://simplifier.net/guide/DoseSyntaxImplementationGuidanceforFHIRR4/Home

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Amount of dose medication .Note that this specifies the quantity of the specified medication, not the quantity for each active ingredient(s). Each ingredient amount can be communicated in the Medication resource. For example, if one wants to communicate that a tablet was 375 mg, where the dose was one tablet, you can use the Medication resource to document that the tablet was comprised of 375 mg of drug XYZ. Alternatively if the dose was 375 mg, then you may only need to use the Medication resource to indicate this was a tablet. If the example were an IV such as dopamine and you wanted to communicate that 400mg of dopamine was mixed in 500 ml of some IV solution, then this would all be communicated in the Medication resource. If the administration is not intended to be instantaneous (rate is present or timing has a duration), this can be specified to convey the total amount to be administered over the period of time as indicated by the schedule e.g. 500 ml in dose, with timing used ...

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Amount of medication per unit of time. Identifies the speed with which the medication was or will be introduced into the patient. Typically the rate for an infusion e.g. 100 ml per 1 hour or 100 ml/hr. May also be expressed as a rate per unit of time e.g. 500 ml per 2 hours. Other examples: 200 mcg/min or 200 mcg/1 minute; 1 liter/8 hours. Sometimes, a rate can imply duration when expressed as total volume / duration (e.g. 500mL/2 hours implies a duration of 2 hours). However, when rate doesn't imply duration (e.g. 250mL/hour), then the timing.repeat.duration is needed to convey the infuse over time period.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A slot containing a structural, computable representation of dose timing and maximum dose. This element will generally only be used when persisting data within systems with 'parsable dose directions' being used to exchange the same information between systems. As per FHIR Dose Syntax Implementation Guidance (NHS Digital): https://simplifier.net/guide/DoseSyntaxImplementationGuidanceforFHIRR4/Home

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Recommendation of the time period for which the medication should be continued, including direction not to discontinue. As per FHIR Dose Syntax Implementation Guidance (NHS Digital): https://simplifier.net/guide/DoseSyntaxImplementationGuidanceforFHIRR4/Home

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: When sharing Dose duration direction, the following examples are provided to clarify definitions for two of the coded text items which appear similar. In both cases, these directions are not an absolute instruction. They are: ‘continue medication indefinitely’ - ongoing treatment planned for example when starting daily aspirin or a statin. There will be circumstances where you would stop them such as a GI (gastrointestinal) bleed. ‘do not discontinue’ refers to medication where suddenly stopping could be dangerous, for example the abrupt withdrawal of long-term steroids.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Describes the entire medication dosage and administration directions including dose quantity and medication frequency and optionally duration e.g. “1 tablet at night" or “2mg at 10pm”.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Allows for: requirements for adherence support, e.g. compliance aids, prompts and packaging requirements, additional information about specific medicines e.g. where specific brand required, person requirements, e.g. unable to swallow tablets.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: FHIR value set : - Additional instruction

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Details of the overall course of medication.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The status of this prescription.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: FHIR value set : - Medication status

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Reason for medication being prescribed, where known.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The date and/or time that the medication course should begin.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The date and/or time that the medication course should finish.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A link to the record which contains the indication for this medication order.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text with URL

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Suggestions about duration and/or review, ongoing monitoring requirements, advice on starting, discontinuing or changing medication. Additional comment or recommendation about the medication course e.g. 'Patient named supply', 'unlicensed medication', 'Foreign brand' or monitoring recommendations

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Records the changes made to medication.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The nature of any change made to the medication.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: FHIR value set : Medication status

TaggedValue.name: description

TaggedValue.name: valueSets

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Where a change is made to the medication i.e. one drug stopped and another started or eg dose, frequency or route is changed.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The total daily dose of this medication. This is helpful for estimating optimal adherence to dosing guidance. It may be computed from product/dose strength and frequency or entered manually.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: valueSets

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: valueSets

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The clinical indication for any changes in medication status

TaggedValue.name: valueSets

TaggedValue.name: valueSets

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The details of planned investigations, procedures and treatment, and whether this plan has been agreed with the person or their legitimate representative.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This is a plan and requested actions record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

TaggedValue.name: implementationGuidance
TaggedValue.value: This is the treatment plan for the treating team or clinician and any actions requested. This plan should make clear who is expected to take responsibility for actions following an encounter, for example the person receiving care or their carer; the GP or another heath care professional. For example, follow up renal function test to be arranged by the GP within two weeks of appointment. Shared decision-making principles should apply to the development of the plan and where the person’s opinions differ, this should be included under ‘Agreed with the person or their legitimate person representative’ which will include both the aspects of the plan the person (or their representative) agree with and the aspects they disagree with. The section would allow for the recording of planned investigations, procedures and treatment for the person’s identified conditions and priorities. This is not a care plan it is a plan for specific actions to be carried out as a result of an encounter.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Including planned investigations, procedures and treatment for a person's identified conditions and priorities. For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including the person’s expectations. A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location, strategies.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including person’s expectations. A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location, strategies.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Indicates whether the person or their legitimate representative has agreed the entire plan or individual aspects of treatment, expected outcomes, risks and alternative treatments. A record of the agreement of the decisions made.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The details of the outcome of the plan and requested actions.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text.
